member.name: IDiscMaster.ClearFormatContent
member.summary: Clears the contents of an unburned image (the current stash file).
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscMaster.Close
member.summary: Closes the interface so other applications can use it.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

member.name: IDiscMaster.EnumDiscMasterFormats
member.summary: Retrieves an enumerator for all disc mastering formats supported by this disc master object. A disc master format specifies the structure of the content in a staged image file (data/audio) and the interface that manages the staged image.
member.param: Address of a pointer to the IEnumDiscMasterFormats enumerator.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscMaster.EnumDiscRecorders
member.summary: Retrieves an enumerator for all disc recorders supported by the active disc master format.
member.param: Address of a pointer to the IEnumDiscRecorders enumerator.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscMaster.GetActiveDiscMasterFormat
member.summary: Retrieves the active disc recorder format. The active format specifies both the structure of the staged image file content (audio/data) and the COM interface that must be used to manipulate that staged image.
member.param: IID of the currently active format.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscMaster.Open
member.summary: Opens an upper-level IMAPI object for access by a client application.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscMaster.ProgressAdvise
member.summary: Registers an application for progress notifications.
member.param: Pointer to an interface that receives the progress notifications.
Uniquely identifies this registration. Save this value because it will be needed by the method.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscMaster.ProgressUnadvise
member.summary: Cancels progress notifications for an application.
member.param: Value returned by a previous call to the method.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscMaster.RecordDisc
member.summary: Burns the staged image to media in the active disc recorder.
member.param: Indicates whether the media is burned. If this parameter is TRUE, media in the active disc recorder is not actually burned. Instead, a simulated burn is performed. The simulation is a good test of a disc recorder, because most of the operations are performed as in a real burn. If this parameter is FALSE, then the media in the recorder is actually burned.
Indicates whether to eject the media after the burn. If this parameter is TRUE, the media is ejected. If this parameter is FALSE, the media is not ejected.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscMaster.SetActiveDiscMasterFormat
member.summary: Sets the currently active disc recorder format. The active format specifies both the structure of the staged image file content (audio/data) and the COM interface that must be used to manipulate that staged image.
member.param: IID of the currently active format.
Pointer to the COM interface for the new disc format.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscMaster.SetActiveDiscRecorder
member.summary: Selects an active disc recorder. The active disc recorder is the recorder where a burn will occur when is called.
member.param: Pointer to the interface of a disc recorder object. This pointer should have been returned by a previous call to.
member.returns: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

member.name: IDiscMaster
member.summary: TheIDiscMaster interface allows an application to reserve an image mastering API, enumerate disc mastering formats and disc recorders supported by an image mastering object, and start a simulated or actual burn of a disc. Although an image mastering object can support several formats, it may not be possible to access all formats through a specific recorder. For this reason, you must select a recorder with after selecting a format with.
